title: Is anyone trully satisfied with rek'sai being a tank
body:
Since some patches thats basicaly the role she serves ...

but with any champion that is flexible nerfs have a side effect ... they dont reduce the power but change the direction it is channeled

so from a damage dealer rek sai evolwed into a "knock-up bot" 

i personaly dont like that about her ... you have 6 skills and only 2 prove to be usefull late (unburrow and tunnel) 

i would like to know what is others opinion on this ... do you like rek'sai as a tank or would you prefer her to be a hunter (she isnt a marksman so i dont think that word "damege dealer" would fit)

Consider how her damage is supposed to be dealt:

- Basic attacks as a melee champion without any movement speed boosts or slows. Not good.

- AoE basic attacks on Q. Best used in the middle of the team.

- E dealing more damage with more rage, generated by, you guessed it, basic attacks.

- All burrowed abilities drain her rage, including her gap closer, which isn't even that fast.

So basically all her damage is in basic attacks and E, which needs basic attacks to build up in damage. Not only that, but she can't use any of her burrowed abilities while generating rage. She simply cannot function as a damage dealer because it's far too difficult for her to build up rage for an E nuke, which is her only damage source besides burrowed Q, which doesn't deal that much. It's absolutely no surprise she ended up as a Tank.

Nope, when she came out I was excited for the first DPS/duelist fighter the game had seen in ages, but then in cookie cutter fashion, Riot chose to nerf everything about her damage instead of nerfing her durability or utility. Marksman aren't the only damage roll, they don't have a monoploy on being a damage dealer.

There are also fighters, assassins, and mages as major damage dealers.

Usually post-game damage stats from all 4 damage rolls are pretty much the same. What differs is more their means of surviving long enough to deal damage: fighters have tankyness, assassins mobility, mages range, marksman a combination of range and mobility, a few fighters a combination of mobility and defense.

The only thing damage is really counter-balanced against is CC/utility

Unfortunately for the future of assassin Rek'Sai, her global presence is a lot more in the CC/utility direction than anything else.

Riot is currently fixated in creating melee kits that have high base but low ratios so players are forced to play them as tanks.
The truth of the matter is that being melee is a tremendous disadvantage against champions with range.

Ranged champions not only have the safety of casting from afar, but they also come with some of the highest damage in game. The only way for a melee champion besides assassins with long ranged gap closers to get close to ranged enemies is to be tanky enough to soak up their damage.

Rek'sai falls into this melee category. Her tunnel gap closer is easily avoidable, and she must knock up her target before being kited to death. Therefore, she can't build full or mostly damage.

The outliers to this rule are often regarded as overpowered or broken. Champions either have extreme mobility with heavy damage mitigation mechanics such as Yasuo, Yi, and Tryndamere or have high damage mechanics despite building tanky such as Jax, Shyvana, and Hercarim.
